Set Up Your Business Entities

Main Street Pulse can track your business entities, whether active or passive income businesses. The business entities that you can set up are:

  • C-corp
  • DBA
  • Estate
  • LLC
  • Partnership
  • S-corp
  • Sole proprietorship
  • Trust
  • Other

To start, navigate to the Business Entities page and click "Add new." Enter the company name and date formed, as they are required.

In addition to the company details, you can enter information about:

  • Company members or owners
  • Registered Agent
  • Assets the company owns
  • Board members or advisors
  • Board meeting dates
  • Beneficiaries
  • Documents (coming soon)

The more information you enter, the more Main Street Pulse can help you track and be alerted to upcoming dates.

Each month, the Monthly Pulse email reminds you of the business renewal date, registered agent renewal, and FinCEN registration. More reminders will be coming soon.

Linking assets

Main Street Pulse's goal is to give you an overview of your portfolio and help you see how everything works together as you plan and manage your wealth. Adding assets will give you a better idea of how everything is structured.

Go into the business entity you want to manage and click on the Assets tab. Click on "Add assets," and this will give you the option to:

  • Create a new asset
  • Link an existing real estate asset
  • Link an existing business entity

When you select to link an existing real estate or business entity asset, you will see a dropdown with your current assets listed. If you create a new asset, you can define its type and provide more information about it. There are many options of assets to add, but some of the most popular are:

  • Bank accounts
  • Brokerage accounts
  • 401k accounts
  • Cryptocurrencies
  • IRAs

Those with an ordinary income business, are you taking advantage of a solo 401k? Learn more from our partner.
